item.title: Road closure signs and cones blown over, 3rd October
item.description:
The road is closed. The signs and cones that were blocking the road have blown over. Cars are trying to access the road still as they cannot see the road closure sign when turning left. This is causing traffic jams and a great deal of car horn usage at all hours.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Marshall Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs replacing as now leaning towards building and is dangerous, 3rd October
item.description:
The Crab Apple Tree is now leaning towards both 14 and 14A Percy Road SE207QJ and could with the current wind fall over and damage both properties and the occupants . It has also started to lift the pavement and if it moves any further towards the building it will also bring the Telegraph pole down across the road as it has a landline, line going through it attached to that pole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Percy Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faeces in communal staircase, 3rd October
item.description:
There is what looks like human faeces on the staircase of the building, 3 staircases up. It smells and is attracting flies. There is also a pair of shoes on the second staircase up however this is a less pressing issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmington Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags zip-tied to lampposts along Finchley road and posters fixed to unoccupied business on street level, 3rd October
item.description:
A small group of people drove down the street at around 4am and attached flags to lampposts along main road with zip ties. Concerned these will become unsafe and fall into traffic, they're also causing noise nuisance to residents on the level of the flag. There are also posters that have been stuck to the windows of the unoccupied shop on the corner of bridge lane going to Finchley road, these were taken down once about 2 months ago, but have been put back up and overall have been up for most of 2025.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Finchley Road, Temple Fortune, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big dip in road, 3rd October
item.description:
There is a big dip in the road that first began about 2 weeks ago and is now getting worse and bigger looking like it will collapse in
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maximfeldt Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New pedestrian junction causing multiple tyre blow outs, 3rd October
item.description:
Since this new junction has been put in place I have witnessed multiple cars experience tyre blow out when they accidentally clip the edge of the new pavement. None of these have been caused by speeding or reckless driving. This corners of this new pedestrian junction need to be addressed as the car tyre blow outs present a risk to pedestrians in the area which was not the case prior to this intervention
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): George Lane, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
